Title: If every eigenvalue of $A$ is zero, does this mean $A$ is a zero matrix?
Content:
If every eigenvalue of $A$ is zero, show that $A$ is nilpotent.
I got this question as my homework. I am just wondering if every eigenvalue of $A$ is zero, then $A$ is zero, why bother to prove $A$ is nilpotent.
AcceptedAnswer: No, any strictly upper triangular matrix, such as: $$\begin{pmatrix}0&1\\0&0\end{pmatrix}$$ will have all eigenvalues zero.
